version_note: Curated extraction based on page-verified content; figures refer to manual figures.

rules.title: Minimum & Maximum Lot Sizes by Zone
rules.summary: Defines typical minimum lot sizes for R-1 subzones and flag lots; provides exceptions to maximum lot size.

requirements.substandard_definition: width < 50 ft OR depth < 83 ft AND area ≤ 83% of minimum lot size for zone

rules.notes: Exceptions to max lot size include lot line removals to eliminate nonconformities, combining substandard lots, or where lots increase or stay same without net housing loss.

rules.title: Gross vs. Net Lot Area
rules.summary: Net lot area excludes certain portions of the gross area.
requirements: Exclude street right-of-way from net area
Exclude the 'pole' of a flag lot
Exclude creek channel area within creek easements
citations: Gross vs. net lot area diagrams on page 3

rules.title: Lot Coverage (LC)
rules.summary: Maximum lot coverage and what counts/does not count.
requirements: Max lot coverage = 35% of lot size
Additional 5% permitted for covered patios/canopies/eaves beyond 4 ft
Count footprints of all structures; projecting elements (balconies, stairways, porches, patio covers); decks >30" above grade; pools/spas >30" above grade; eave portions beyond 4'
Exclude roof overhangs up to 4' and uncovered structures <30" above grade

rules.title: Gross Floor Area (GFA) Formula & Cap
rules.summary: Defines the GFA calculation and what is included.
requirements: GFA = 45% of first 5,000 sf of lot area + 30% of lot area over 5,000 sf
Main house GFA may not exceed 6,000 sf regardless of lot size
includes: All floors measured to outside of exterior stud walls

rules.title: Roofed 1st-Floor Porches—Openness Test
rules.summary: A roofed 1st-floor porch does NOT count toward GFA if openness thresholds are met.
requirements: At least 50% of the porch perimeter is at least 50% open (measured from porch floor to underside of roof material)
If porch floor >30" above grade, guard design must keep facades open (e.g., railings vs. solid half walls)

rules.title: Vaulted Entry Features (>12' high)
rules.summary: Footprint of a vaulted entry counts twice toward GFA regardless of openness.
requirements: Height measured from grade to intersection of façade and roof (shed/gable) determines if vaulted (>12')
If second floor exists above a vaulted entry, that second-floor area still counts normally (totaling three counts)

rules.title: Recessed 1st-Floor Porches
rules.summary: Recessed porches do not count if all criteria are met; otherwise they count (and may count twice if >17').
requirements: Depth <10' AND porch ceiling is below 2nd floor AND exterior side is substantially open → does NOT count
If porch space is higher than 17' above finished floor, counts again as 2nd-story equivalency

rules.title: Upper-Floor Roofed Outdoor Areas
rules.summary: Roofed outdoor areas on upper floors count toward GFA regardless of openness.
requirements: Considered roofed if eave over outdoor area is deeper than eave over rest of building

rules.title: Attic, Closet, & Perimeter Spaces
rules.summary: On accessible floors, areas with ≥5' head clearance count toward GFA.
requirements: Accessible floors with ≥5' headroom count regardless of use
rules.notes: Historic Category 1 & 2 homes may exempt 500 sf of unusable attic space.

rules.title: 2nd & 3rd Floor Equivalency
rules.summary: Open volumes above first floor count again as equivalency thresholds are crossed.
requirements: Areas higher than 17' above first floor count as 2nd-floor equivalency (if not already counted)
Areas higher than 26' above first floor count as 3rd-floor equivalency
Stairwells measured the same way as vaulted spaces
Exemption: up to 200 sf of 3rd-floor equivalency where roof pitch is ≥4:12

rules.title: Bay Windows Not Counting Toward GFA (Decorative)
rules.summary: Bay windows are exempt if all design criteria are met.
requirements: Bottom ≥18" above floor joists
Exterior support via corbels/brackets (not solid walls)
≥50% of surface is glass
rules.notes: Bay windows extending higher than roof are dormers and do count toward GFA.

rules.title: Fireplaces, Chimneys, Sheds, Planters
rules.summary: These elements generally count toward GFA.
requirements: Fireplaces count once toward GFA regardless of configuration
Sheds/planters/other projections >5' high count toward GFA

rules.title: Standard Setbacks by Zone
rules.summary: Baseline front, rear, interior-side, and street-side setbacks for R-1 zones and special cases.
requirements: Front: Contextual or 20' (see contextual rule)
Rear: 20'
Interior side: 6'–8' by subzone
Street side: 16' (10' for substandard corner lots <50' wide)

rules.title: Contextual Front Setback
rules.summary: Applies only if the same-side block average ≥30'.
requirements: Compute average of existing setbacks on same block side; if ≥30', use that as contextual setback; else use 20'

rules.title: Easements & Sidewalk Considerations
rules.summary: Where to measure setbacks from when easements/ROW differ from sidewalk location.
requirements: Measure from lot line, not sidewalk
Public street and creek easements can shift setback baselines

rules.title: Odd Lot Shapes & Reduced Setbacks
rules.summary: Guidance and diagrams for flag, corner, through, wedge, and multi-sided lots; reduced setbacks in specific cases.
requirements: Flag lots: reduced front setback (e.g., 10')
Substandard corner lots <50' wide: street-side yard may be 10'

rules.title: Allowable Encroachments (Summary)
rules.summary: Permitted ground-floor encroachments and dimensions into required yards.
requirements: Rear yard: 1st-floor portion at rear may extend half building width to within 14' of rear lot line
Extensions of existing encroachments: front to within 14', interior side to within 5', street side to within 10' (ground floor only)
1st-floor balconies/porches/stairways: 6' into front/rear; 3' into side
Eaves/cornices: 2' into side; 4' into front/rear
Bay/greenhouse windows: 2' into front; 3' into rear; greenhouse windows: 2' into side
Lightwells/stairwells: 3' into side, 4' into rear (total length ≤15')
Below-grade patios: 2' into side, 4' into rear (total length ≤15')
Uncovered parking permitted in rear/side yards (except first 10' of street-side)

rules.title: Primary Daylight Plane (Side & Rear)
rules.summary: Defines the primary daylight plane for structures in buildable area and how to measure average grade.
requirements: Measure height from average of grade at building midpoint and closest point on abutting site
Allowed eave protrusion into daylight plane: 2'
Dormers/roof decks/gables: each ≤7.5' length; total ≤15' per side; ≥5' separation; height ≤24'
Chimneys/flues (<5' wide) & antennas may extend to meet code/height allowances

rules.title: Accessory Structures—General
rules.summary: Use, separation, permit, and yard restrictions for non-dwelling accessory structures.
requirements: Must be detached and ≥3' from main dwelling; no kitchens
Count toward lot coverage; >120 sf require building permit and count toward GFA
In buildable area: subject to same height/daylight as main dwelling
In required setbacks: not in front or street-side yards; not in rear yard of through lots; may not cover >50% of rear yard; no sleeping/living
If >200 sf: max two plumbing fixtures

rules.title: Accessory-Structure Daylight Plane (Rear/Side Yards)
rules.summary: Lower daylight plane governs accessory structures in rear/side yards; garages taking setback exceptions are subject to this.
requirements: Detached garages/carports in rear/side subject to accessory daylight plane when using setback exceptions

rules.title: Noise-Producing Equipment Siting
rules.summary: Location limits and insulation/waiver conditions.
requirements: Not in front, rear, or interior-side yards; up to 6' encroachment into street-side yard
Must meet City Noise Ordinance; insulation/housing required unless waived when in buildable area with compliant specs/screening

rules.title: Parking Space Standards
rules.summary: On-lot parking requirements and minimum dimensions.
requirements: Two spaces per dwelling; one must be covered
No spaces in required front yard or first 10' of street-side yard
Uncovered space min 8.5'×18'
Covered space clear inside: 10'×20' per space (two-car: 20'×20')
Vertical clearance min 7'
Covered parking must be ≥3' from main dwelling to be 'detached'
No underground garages except by variance

rules.title: Driveway Standards
rules.summary: Width/clearance, surfacing near ROW, permeable limit in front yard.
requirements: Driveway clearance ≥10'; surface ≥8' wide
No loose material within 10' of ROW
No more than 40% of required front yard may be impermeable
Street-work permit required for work in ROW
City encourages one curb cut per frontage and 50' min from intersections

rules.title: Contextual Garage Placement
rules.summary: Applies where there is a predominant neighborhood garage pattern on the relevant block segment.
requirements: If block >600', consider only lots within 600' or nearest 10 lots
For corner lots, evaluate pattern on the street the garage faces

rules.title: Siting of Attached & Detached Garages/Carports
rules.summary: Attached garages follow main-dwelling setbacks; detached may use rear/side with distance criteria.
requirements: Attached: comply with main-dwelling setbacks
Detached: may be in rear/interior-side if ≥75' from front lot line and ≥20' from street-side lot line
On lots <95' deep: detached may be in rear/interior-side if in rear half of lot
Uncovered spaces must be beyond required front yard and first 10' of street-side yard

rules.title: Basement FAR & Standards
rules.summary: Basement GFA exclusion and placement limits.
requirements: Basement area does NOT count toward FAR if first floor is ≤3' above grade
Basements may not be in special flood hazard areas
May not extend beyond building footprint
May not encroach into required yards (except where main dwelling may extend into rear yard per allowances)

rules.title: Light Wells & Stairwells
rules.summary: Dimensional, encroachment, and cumulative-length limits.
requirements: Not on side of structure facing front yard
Interior width ≤3'
Combined opening length ≤30% of basement perimeter
Encroachment: ≤3' into side yards (min 3' from lot line); ≤4' into rear yard
Cumulative encroaching length across all yards ≤15'
Must not harm neighboring trees; drainage must be approved (Public Works)

rules.title: Below-Grade Patios
rules.summary: Area limits, separation, and encroachments; screening/compatibility expectations.
requirements: Total area of all below-grade patios ≤2% of lot area or 200 sf (whichever greater); no single patio >200 sf (egress stair area not counted toward 200 sf limit)
Patios separated by ≥10'
Encroachment: ≤2' into side yards; ≤4' into rear yard
Cumulative encroaching length across all yards ≤15'
Must be screened and architecturally compatible; overhangs/canopies count toward lot coverage; drainage approval required

rules.title: Tree Protection & Screening
rules.summary: Excavation must avoid damaging tree roots and may require guardrail/landscape screening.
requirements: Tree roots often within top 18"; root zone extends beyond drip line—plan excavation accordingly
Provide evidence prior to permit that features won’t harm trees on subject or abutting lots
Guard rails must be architecturally compatible; screening may be required by Planning

rules.title: Second Dwelling Units—Lot Size & Standards
rules.summary: Threshold lot sizes; unit size & height caps; parking; compatibility; siting rules.
requirements: Attached unit: max 450 sf; height ≤17'; counts toward lot FAR; two parking spaces (one covered; covered parking ≤200 sf for the unit)
Detached unit: max 900 sf; height ≤17'; share driveway with main dwelling; two parking spaces (one covered; covered parking ≤200 sf for the unit)
Entrance orientation and exterior stair placement constraints (e.g., not facing same lot line as main entry; exterior stairs toward interior side/rear)
Detached ADU to be ≥12' from main dwelling; architecturally compatible

rules.title: Height Limits
rules.summary: Maximum structure heights by type and roof slope.
requirements: Main dwelling on standard lot: max height 30' (or 33' with 12:12 roof per table depiction)
Main dwelling on substandard or flag lot: 17' (single-story)
Accessory structures in rear/side yard: 12'
Second dwelling units: 17'

rules.title: Grade Definitions & Measurement
rules.summary: Which grade to use for structures and daylight plane; special rule for slopes >10%.
requirements: Existing grade used for structures on land with natural slope ≤10%
For natural slope >10%: measure from finished or existing grade (whichever is lower) at any point of the structure
For daylight plane: use average of grade at building midpoint and grade at closest point on abutting site
